definition: to return empty-handed/to fail to win anything
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.chinese: 最后只有五个家庭空手而归。

sentences.english: No one shall appear before me empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都不应出现在我面前空手而归。

sentences.english: The door of grace is always open for her petitions, and they never return empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 恩典之门总为她的恳求而开，恳求者也永不空手而归。

sentences.english: Mr. Shields didn't leave empty-handed, however.
sentences.chinese: 不过希尔兹也没有空手而归。

sentences.english: From Your temple, no one returns empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 从你的寺庙没有人空手而归。

sentences.english: A good haggler knows when to walk away empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 砍价好手清楚什么时候空手而归。

sentences.english: They go back to the house empty-handed, and Magan's little brother is gloating.
sentences.chinese: 他们空手而归，马江的弟弟有点幸灾乐祸。
空手而归这是我丈夫的朋友。

sentences.english: Dozens of others went empty-handed, Reuters reported.
sentences.chinese: 据路透社报道，许多人都空手而归。

sentences.english: But they are bound to be disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他们必定空手而归。

definition: to return from a rewarding journey
empty-handed (idiom); fig. not receiving anything
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to make a journey for nothing
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
to go on an errand for nothing/to go on a wild-goose chase
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
to return without any achievement (idiom); to go home with one's tail between one's legs
treasure hunt
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
to return in low spirits following a defeat or failure to achieve one's ambitions (idiom)
hopes are dashed
